span.strong: Have a question? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions.
MSD staff looking for teaching resources? Click here.
MSD families looking for learning resources? Click here.
Looking for the Anywhere Learning TV Guide? Click here.
Curious about meal times? Click Here: MSD Open Meal Sites.
Need technology help? Click for Students or Staff.
Missed an email from the district? Check our Messages to Staff and Families Document.
Need to speak with someone? Call the main line at 541-842-3636.

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: Two important updates follow, one regarding
Today we learned our students will not return to schools this school year. Governor Brown extended the
p.strong: closure of school buildings through the end of the school year,
p.span: in an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19 and keep our community well.
Fortunately, thanks to the tireless efforts of our MSD educators, the Medford School District is well-equipped for this news, and education through

continues. The Medford School District is a place where ALL are learning and learning is for ALL, and we remain committed to serving students and delivering meaningful learning experiences for the duration of the school year.

We know many of you are experiencing challenges and hardships during this unprecedented time. Every day seems to bring a new definition of “normalcy,” and those changes can be stressful for us all. Please remember this: we are in this together. Please do not hesitate to contact your school or the district if you have concerns we can help with.

Families with questions about meal services, Chromebook distribution or how to connect to school work, please reach out to your school or to the district at 541-842-3636. For questions about technology access, please call 541-842-1111. If you leave a message at your school, someone will call you back. Also, don’t forget that we continue to serve hot meals at our
, with expansion into other sites with take-away meals, as well.

em.span: This year is particularly challenging for our seniors, our Class of 2020.

p.span: Governor Brown also announced today a plan surrounding

. We are still digging into the guidance, but the primary takeaway is that seniors will receive credit for any MSD course in which they were passing at the time of the extended school closure. (If the student is in a dual credit or AP class we will continue to support them in continuing to prepare for AP exams and to earn college credits if possible; more details will come from your teacher or school.) Put simply: If a student was on track to graduate on March 13, that student is STILL on track to graduate!

As a result of the Pathways to Graduation plan, schools can provide additional focus on securing credit-earning opportunities and learning for seniors who were not yet passing all required courses at the time of the school closure. This plan maintains the 24 credit requirement for the Oregon Diploma, honoring high standards for learning and achievement.

The extended closure also means that proms, graduations, award ceremonies, spring sports and other important student milestones will be experienced differently. We have a team of dedicated educators, parents, and students in place to reimagine how to deliver these experiences. For example, for graduation, we are considering a late summer graduation ceremony and/or a virtual ceremony in June. A final decision related to graduation ceremonies and other events will be shared by the end of April.

Finally, the amount of information coming at each of us every day can be overwhelming, and we wanted to pause and say, “Thank you.” From the staff members serving meals to the teachers adapting to remote learning to the families at home juggling work, school, and life – we are grateful for the kindness you show to one another. We will need patience, resilience, strength, and, of course, grace as we move through these next few months.

span.p: The Medford School District and its food services provider Sodexo will serve free “grab and go” meals for kids 18 and under at six locations throughout the district (on weekdays) throughout the closure. That includes the week of spring break.
A "dry" breakfast (for the next day) will be served at lunch from 11:00AM - 12:30PM.

ul.li:
North Medford High School
1900 N Keene Way Dr, Medford, OR 97504

Howard Elementary School
286 Mace Rd, Medford, OR 97501

Jefferson Elementary School
333 Holmes Ave, Medford, OR 97501

Roosevelt Elementary School
1212 Queen Anne Ave, Medford, OR 97504

Jackson Elementary School
713 Summit Avenue, Medford, OR 97501

Oak Grove Elementary School
2838 W Main Street, Medford, OR 97501

span.p: NEW: The Ruch community can now access cold lunch pickups Monday - Friday at the following times:

Visitors are asked to enter through designated doors, pick up a meal from the cafeteria and then take the meal to go. Gathering inside the school will be discouraged. We are grateful to our MSD staff who are volunteering to staff the sites!
Medford School District custodial staff will be cleaning before and after each meal.

strong.br: NEW! MSD Meals on the Move

span.p: A partnership between the Medford School District (MSD), Sodexo, and First Student to provide free and accessible meals to students in neighborhoods throughout the Medford School District boundaries. MSD Meals on the Move operates starting Wednesday, April 22. Buses will arrive around 11 AM and stay until 12:15 PM. Social distancing will be observed and all buses will be cleaned daily.
Locations can be found at www.medford.k12.or.us/mealsonthemove
